Posts.Content: Ask for a MRI!!! Certain cancers will NOT show up on a mammogram. I know!! My cancer had actually left the breasts and gone to the bones and stomach. My breasts are actually cancer free. I had a mammogram and ultra-sound every year...and nothing was ever found.
Posts.Title: Worried Misfiagnosis!

Posts.Content: On 3/25/2009 Blessedl wrote:                               My friend is a   a 48 year old woman diagnosed in Sept./08 with breast cancer metasasized to the bone.  Chemotheraphy did not work and      she is on Femara - scored8 out of 8 to respond well to this drug.  Was told had 1-2 years on average to live.  Just wondering if anyone out there has had the same experience, and if so, what were the results.  Looking for positive responses. I was diagnosed 2 years ago, Stage 4 to bones and stomach. Have been in complete remission on Femara for one year. I asked a doctor at M.D. Anderson how long he thought I had, and he said "Only God knows". I know of one lady that Femara has kept her cancer in check for 9 years. Think positive, pray, and LIVE!
Posts.Title: breastcancermetasasizedtobone

Posts.Content: Mine did not show up on mammogram or utrasounds. It showed up at Stage 4, in my bones and stomach. An mri of the breast did NOT show cancer. BUT it was breast cancer in the bones and stomach. I am now in complete remission, on Femara and Arredia. A day at a time with this stuff!! God Bless and Best wishes.
Posts.Title: Did anyone's cancer NOT show up on Mammogram or Ultrasound?

Posts.Content: Apply for disability, with it will come Medicare which will help  you!
Posts.Title: pancreatic cancer cost

Posts.Content: I am est.rec. Stage 4, mets to stomach and bones. Diagnosed two years ago this month. had radiation on my spine and sternum for the pain. I take arredia, and Femara. I have been in Complete Remission for one year. I have two great doc's in Atlanta, and had my second opinion done at M.D. Anderson in Houston. How long will this last?? I do not know. I asked my doc at M.D. Anderson how long I would live, and he wisely said "Only God Knows!" I was told by all three doctors that I would never hear the Remission word, but that they would try to make my cancer chronic. Keep- your head up girl, this will be quite a ride!!!
Posts.Title: Stage IV breast cancer spread to liver and bones

Posts.Content: Apply for disability immediately!!! With it will come Medicare after one year. If denied, appeal. I got it on the first application!
Posts.Title: Financial Assistance I NEED HELP!!!

Posts.Content: I am a Stsge 4 and will be on Femara, or some med forever. I went to a pain doctor for all the joint, foot, hands, etc pain. He put me on Cymbalta for 2 months, and the neuropathy pain was GONE! It really really helped me. Ask your doctor about it. Since I am in an unexpected remission, I will put up happily with the Femara. Have to say the side effects are now tapering off after 2 years.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: On 11/26/2008 Anna M wrote: I myself just found out in August I have metaplastic carcinoma. Just went through a mastectomy and recovering okay.I will chemo in a couple of weeks and so terrified. i dont want to lose my hair but dont want to lose my life either. I hve two beautiful daughters to take care of since i am a single mother. I dont want them to see me sick and and i know I must stay strong in order for them to be strong. My tumor was 7 cm and thought it was due to an injury i sustained in december 07. I know what yall must be thinking........stupid!!!!!And youre right. i really believed it was just an injury. But now i know otherwise and must deal with it on a daily basis. I am a pretty strong person and have a wonderful support group right there beside me. I dont know what i would do without them. Whats funny is its my ex in laws that are helping me. I lost my parents several years ago. I also need to mention that I am 45 and have no clue who my biological parents are. I m now in the process trying to find them which is not easy. I just take one day ata time and smile each day because I am so very THANKFUL for it. Have a wonderful day and God bless to all!!! If your doctor is at M.D. Anderson in Houston, you are in the BEST hands possible. I live in Atlanta and used M.D. Anderson for my 2nd opinion God Bless! Shirley.
Posts.Title: I Just Found Out I Have Breast Cancer!

Posts.Content: I am stage 4, no breast surgery.  Found in my bones and stomach.  I have had 3 years of remission.  Now, after a Lap. surgery, due to bloating and gut pain, they found that my abdominal cavity if FULL of cancer.  I never have tumors, just one cell at a time stuff.  I am stunned.  Have anyone every had this?????  What do they do???  I see my doctor on Tuesday, and I am scared to death!!!!
Posts.Title: diagnoised with stage iv breast cancer metastasized to bones in spine and pelvic

Posts.Content: On Jun 10, 2010 2:57 PM Rivergal wrote: On Jun 05, 2010 5:00 AM cirlady wrote: My friend was recently told she has ILC.  Going to UM for second opinion on Monday this coming week.  Two weeks ago her nipple looked "normal", today the nipple is looking deformed - her comment.   What's going one from one week to another... I'm concerned.   I have stage IV lobular breast cancer with mets to my bones but it has not ever effected my nipples.  You can tell your friend that ILC is one of the 'better' cancers to have because it's very treatable.  Even tho' I am stage 4, I really have no symptoms other than backache.  I've had no chemo, no radiation & no surgery & just take a daily Femara pill & a monthly infusion of Zometa to strengthen my bones & I've been told by 4 different oncologists in 4 different cities that I can "live for years" with this cancer as long as my meds keep working.  Mostly, I feel fine & have not changed my lifestyle at all.  I feel quite 'lucky' to have this particular cancer. Hope your friend is as lucky..... take care, Toni   My cancer and treatment were almost exactly like yours.  After 4 years, now has reappeared to peritoneal area......has tied up intestines, etc.  On my 2nd chemo, first did not work.  any ideas from any one?
Posts.Title: Invasive Lobular Cancer

Posts.Content: Soy is not reccomended with ER BC.  It acts as estrogen.
Posts.Title: It has returned now in my vertebrae

Posts.Content: Soy is not reccomended with ER BC.  It acts as estrogen.
Posts.Title: It has returned now in my vertebrae

Posts.Content: On 1/24/2009 barb777 wrote: Hi there, I was wondering if anyone else had advanced BC and is now in remission or was in remission? My breast cancer went to my lungs and mediastinal glands Oct 07. I had radiation to the lungs and hormonal treatment.I am oest+ and prog + but hercepton -.Originally I had invasive ductal carcenoma grade 3 to my left btrteast. My CT scans have been clear all 2008. I am wondering how long the hormonal treatment is effective for? Was on Zolodex before I had an oopherectomy and now only on Arimidex. Would love to hear from someone with similar situation. I was diagnosed in Feb.2007 with stage four breast cancer. I had never had abnormal mammograms or ultra sounds. It took awhile to figure out that is was even breast cancer, since the MRI'S showed only normal breast tissue. I had "Indian File" breast cancer cells in my stomach and in the bones, where bone marrow had previously been. My spine and sternum were badly affected also. I did not need any breast surgery, but had rapidly become more and more ill in the month of tests to try to diagnose the cancer type. (The scope of the stomach and the biopsy's finally gave us a certain diagnosis. First I had radiation on the spine and sternum. Then I began Femara and Arredia infusions. For the past 10 months my bones have shown no cancer, and my stomach scope's and biopsy's are completely normal. I live in Atlanta, and went to M.D. Anderson for my 2nd opinion, and they agreed totally with my doctor's here. This treatment plan has certainly produced great results for me. The Femara cause fatigue and joint pain, but it is working! I had a scope on the stomach in December, it was all fine, and will have a nuclear scan on the bones in one month to see if they are still clear. I had adjusted to having chronic cancer, and was stunned to hear I was in complete remission. Like you, I wonder how long the Femara will work. My doctor has one woman who has been on it for 9 years! We must stay positive, and really take care of ourselves. I exercise, and have reduced as much stress as I can. Good Luck, and God Bless you Barb!
Posts.Title: Anyone else at Stage 4 in remission?

Posts.Content: I am stage 4 breast cancer person. I was given Zometa and had terrible flu-like symptoms, and visual disturbances. I was switched to Arredia infusions which I get once a month. I have always had TMJ like problems, so I have worried if I would even know WHY my jaw was hurting. After two years, I have had NO problems! Don't let fear guide you, be guided by positive thoughts instead. If any problems come up, you will deal with them THEN. My cancer is now in COMPLETE remission with Arredia and a Femara pill each day. Keep positive, and don't cross bridges until you must!!!
Posts.Title: Zometta Intervenous Treaments

Posts.Content: I am on Femara, had terrible joint pains, and now have added Celebrex with GREAT results. Cymbalta also helps with neuropathy pain.
Posts.Title: Done with drugs

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer three years ago, stage 4.  No lumps or tumors, so no surgery needed.  The breast are both cancer free!?!  It had spread to my stomach and bones.  I take femara once a day, and an arredia infusion once a month.  The cancer quickly went in to remission.  Had my stomach scoped in Dec., and biopsied, and all was clean and clear!  I am having bones scans, and MRI'S every three months.  So far so good.  The Femara has caused weight gain, fatigue and joint pain.  The only way someone would notice anything different about me, is that I have always been stick thin, and now have 25 lbs around the middle all of a sudden.  I wish I could get rid of the fatigue!!!  But like you, I keep thinking, this is Stage 4?????   I did have radiation on my spine at the beginning, and that got rid of some pain I had there.  Weird isn't it???????
Posts.Title: Lobular breast cancer?

Posts.Content: Has anyone out there had breast cancer that left the breast and went to other parts of the body. I felt great up until just before diagnosis. I was finally diagnosed with estrogen receptive breast cancer in my stomach and in my bones. I have had radiation and now take Femara and Arredia. I have had no surgery since the MRI shows healthy breast tissue in both breast. I was told my cancer would be chronic, not one to go into remission or be cured. But I have been in complete remission for about 9 months. I know it is only a matter of time before it rears its ugly head! The Femara causes a great deal of joint pain and fatigue. But it is working. Mu cancer was referred to as "indian file" which is why it did not show up on my yearly mammograms. I will be DI nuclear scanned again at the end of Feb. Had stomach scope and biopsy in December-all clear. Just wondering if anyone else has had this???? Shirley
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage4, not in breast

Posts.Content: On Feb 12, 2010 2:59 AM deezin wrote: On Jan 28, 2010 5:47 PM Rivergal wrote: Hi, I am so happy to hear that you are doing well 3 years after being diagnosed! Especially if it had spread to your stomach... I thought that would be a very bad thing, but apparently you managed to beat it! Congrats on that!  We live in a small town with no breast cancer support groups so I've been frustrated by having no one to compare notes with.... Can I make you my 'friend' so we can do that? I appreciate the info!  Keep up the good 'work"!  I too have some extra padding around the middle, not sure I can blame it on the meds, may be more likely too much 'comfort food'. I asked my doc if I should still go on a diet, as I had planned, or if it was like on the TV show "Survivor" where the chubby ones last longer, LOL  He said I did not need to go on a diet.  I would like to do some weight training as I used to but not sure that's ok with cancer in my back bones.  I am also having all my original tests repeated now, & so far, so good.  Dexascan on my back was 'normal'  (weird, as you said), CT of my head is 'normal', just had another nuclear bone scan yesterday, no results yet.  Thanks for writing & please keep in touch!  Toni I was diagnosed with Invasive Lobular Breast Cancer stage II in Dec. 09 . My treatment is 6 treatments of chemo which I am starting my 3rd on Monday. Then masectomy then radiation then 5 yrs. on some kind of pill I forgot the name.  My tumor has gotten smaller just after 2 treatments so I know the chemo is working. I am thinking I may not need mastectomy if it is smaller maybe I will need a lumpectomy It's all so confusing. How come you aren't getting chemo with stage 4? My prayers are with you all Diane Hi Toni!  Where do you live!!??   I just had all of my tests repeated, including the stomach scope, and all clear.......weird!!!  As usual.  I have weight gain, which I HATE, and extreme fatigue, joint pain.  Wish I had a solution for that, but I am alive three years later!  I am trying to figure out ways to battle the side effects.....not much luck so far!  How are you doing?  what about side effects???   shirley in Ga.
Posts.Title: Lobular breast cancer?
